[]Author: David St;
Rating: 5
When: 4 months ago
Great hotel near the Vatican. The hotel was close to public transport and where the locals ate. So getting an authentic Local experience and food was simple.

Author: Amanda Rose;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Overall we enjoyed our experience. Rooms were clean and nice. Staff met accommodations. We only ate there for morning breakfast which was the same each morning. Not many additional amenities to the hotel. Very close to Vatican but far from other tourists stops

Author: M G;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Elegant hotel located on a 5 minute walk from St. Peter's square. We received a room upgrade upon arrival, which was a nice gesture. If possible get a room with balcony as you can see the Dome from there. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the room was spacious and well-equipped as compared to other Rome hotels we have visited. The hotel's staff was courteous and welcoming (apart for some of the waitresses at the restaurant, who were not very attentive - e.g. they would not ask if you need anything like espresso). The hotel is in a very convenient and quiet location. One thing that could be improved is the breakfast - while the variety was satisfactory, it was one and the same each morning. The New Year's buffet dinner was a bit of a disappointment - the mood was not particularly festive and it closed before the start of the new year. Food was also a bit on the bland side.

Author: Bob P.;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Great location near everything! Friendly staff with good english. That's important to me since I'm totally ignorant of other languages. I might have been " put on the elevator" a bit due to a "reservation foul-up" that wouldn't make the room price I had reserved available for 2 days. They gave me an "upgraded" room for the first 2 days for the original price but said I would either have to move to the cheaper room after that or pay the upgraded price to stay in the original room. I decided to stay put. Who wants to pack up and move? Long story short it might have been a simple bait and switch type of thing, but I'm not sure. Oh, the room is nice but I don't know what the "upgrade might be". Recommend none the less.

Author: Kate Heltemes;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
This was our favorite hotel of our European vacation. Very clean and spacious, although I think we had one of the better rooms. Bathroom was great. We had a balcony in the room and a balcony in the bathroom. We did some sink laundry and let it dry in the balcony. This was our plan so we wouldn't have to pack as much clothing. It was easy to catch an uber or taco from this hotel. Walking distance to the subway which was easy to use. We were able to travel to many destinations by walking it taking the subway. I recommend getting a subway ticket that includes unlimited rides for x amount of time. I think we did 48 hours. Breakfast had many options and was very good. While Rome itself was very dirty with trash pretty much all over this hotel was very clean inside and out. I would definitely return to this hotel.

[]Author: Stefano Manzo;
Rating: 4
When: 9 months ago
The Fontana del Putto, of the Renaissance type, is located in the V (Ponte) district, in Via Giulia, leaning against the left corner of the 16th century Palazzo Sacchetti, built on a project by Antonio da Sangallo the Younger to use it as his home. History: The fountain was built in a later period, but always in the 16th century and is attributed to Nanni di Baccio Bigio, who did some restoration work on the palace. Description of the work: The non-functioning fountain (mute) is quite graceful inside a niche, decorated with a valve there is a Putto embracing the tails of two dolphins in the shape of volutes under him, who have their mouths open, from which a time the water poured out on a pan. Two niches frame the niche, adorned with bas-reliefs depicting masks and which have human figures as capitals which are surmounted by a broken lintel above which has two stars on the sides with eight points on the sides, probably heraldic symbols. NOTE on the conservation status of the work: It is not in good condition and a restoration activity is required that would require the integration of the deficiencies and a cleaning of the incrustations.

Author: Paolo Emilio Capaldi;
Rating: 4
When: 4 years ago
Pretty fountain in Via Giulia, leaning against the left corner of Palazzo Sacchetti, corner via the mullet. Made in the second half of the fifteenth century, perhaps by Sangallo the Younger. At the center is a child supported by two dolphins and below, was a pan to collect water. The frame shows two women and two faces of masks. At the center, above the Putto, there is a shell; close the top frame the stars, the Chigi family crest.

Greater sight from the outside, I hope the pictures make sense of the very nice place this is. The architecture is different from other landmarks as it was intended for a different purpose in the religious history. Prepare to walk a lot. I would recommend the walking tour if possible.

Author: Marcel van Poeijer;
Rating: 4
When: 3 months ago
This huge Castle is definitely worth a visit. Even though I did not go in (entrance fee = 15EU), I still loved the outside area and the little park next to it. When you go inside, it is recommended to go before sunrise, as the sunrise view on top of the terrace should be lovely.

Author: Ken Saberi;
Rating: 4
When: 7 months ago
Great place to visit with spectacular views all around Rome. Interesting artefacts and some Papal history to see. Some of the rooms are stunning. There are a lot of stairs so people with mobility issues may struggle although there is a lift to the second level which can be used on request. This does mean that you will lose out on the top terrace which provides the best views. All the staff were extremely helpful and kind.

Author: Dave Ruijer;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
Fun and interactive museum about the great ideas and creations from Leonardo Da Vinci. We went late afternoon without a line stopping us to enter the museum quickly. By entrance you get a map of the museum with pictures of the objects on it. With a little scanner, headphone included, you can tab on the picture what is relevant at the moment you stand in front of an object. You will here a voice in your selected language explaining the background of the piece. Several mechanical creations can be tried. By doing this you get close in the genius mind of Leonardo Da Vinci and realize he went far in front of his era. Also for kids this is a very educative museum wich stimulates the mind. After the tour in the museum you can buy fun souvenirs like T-shirts, books, etc.

Overall we enjoyed our experience. Rooms were clean and nice. Staff met accommodations. We only ate there for morning breakfast which was the same each morning. Not many additional amenities to the hotel. Very close to Vatican but far from other tourists stops

Author: M G;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Elegant hotel located on a 5 minute walk from St. Peter's square. We received a room upgrade upon arrival, which was a nice gesture. If possible get a room with balcony as you can see the Dome from there. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the room was spacious and well-equipped as compared to other Rome hotels we have visited. The hotel's staff was courteous and welcoming (apart for some of the waitresses at the restaurant, who were not very attentive - e.g. they would not ask if you need anything like espresso). The hotel is in a very convenient and quiet location. One thing that could be improved is the breakfast - while the variety was satisfactory, it was one and the same each morning. The New Year's buffet dinner was a bit of a disappointment - the mood was not particularly festive and it closed before the start of the new year. Food was also a bit on the bland side.

Author: Bob P.;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Great location near everything! Friendly staff with good english. That's important to me since I'm totally ignorant of other languages. I might have been " put on the elevator" a bit due to a "reservation foul-up" that wouldn't make the room price I had reserved available for 2 days. They gave me an "upgraded" room for the first 2 days for the original price but said I would either have to move to the cheaper room after that or pay the upgraded price to stay in the original room. I decided to stay put. Who wants to pack up and move? Long story short it might have been a simple bait and switch type of thing, but I'm not sure. Oh, the room is nice but I don't know what the "upgrade might be". Recommend none the less.

Author: Kate Heltemes;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
This was our favorite hotel of our European vacation. Very clean and spacious, although I think we had one of the better rooms. Bathroom was great. We had a balcony in the room and a balcony in the bathroom. We did some sink laundry and let it dry in the balcony. This was our plan so we wouldn't have to pack as much clothing. It was easy to catch an uber or taco from this hotel. Walking distance to the subway which was easy to use. We were able to travel to many destinations by walking it taking the subway. I recommend getting a subway ticket that includes unlimited rides for x amount of time. I think we did 48 hours. Breakfast had many options and was very good. While Rome itself was very dirty with trash pretty much all over this hotel was very clean inside and out. I would definitely return to this hotel.
